channel.title: Calcutta India on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: The last telegram in India
item.description: The telegraphy system in India is coming to an end in July 2013, reports The Christian Science Monitor: At the Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL), India's state-owned telecom company, a message emerges from a dot matrix printer addressing a soldier's Army unit in Delhi. "GRANDMOTHER SERIOUS. 15 DAYS LEAVE EXTENSION," it reads. It's one of about 5,000 such missives still being sent every day by telegram â€“ a format favored for its "sense of urgency and authenticity," explains a BSNL official.
